article: My best friend, Tom, and I live in a senior-citizen apartment in a lovely small town. Tom is a ten-year-old dog and I am a sixty-nine-year-old lady . Years ago, I _ when I retired I would get a dog to _ my golden years. From the very beginning, Tom has always been _ and I never have to tell him anything more than once. He is extremely _ and always puts back the toys where they were after _ .He is a wonderful companion. We sometimes play a _ together. He does many amusing things that make me laugh. As a result, I enjoy his _ . One afternoon, Tom started acting _ . I was sitting on the floor playing with him, _ he started sniffing at the right side of my chest. He had never done anything like this before, suddenly he threw his entire _ at the right side of my chest, and I cried in _ . Soon after this, I felt a lump . After X-rays and tests, doctors told me I _ cancer. When cancer started, for an unknown _ , a wall of calcium built. Then the lump or cancer _ itself to the wall. When Tom _ on me, the force broke the lump away from the calcium wall, which made me _ the lump. Before that, I couldn't see or feel it, so there was no way for me to know it was there. I had a complete _ and the cancer did not spread. The doctors told me if the cancer had gone unfound even six more months, it would have been too late. Was Tom _ of just what he was doing? I'll never really know. What I do know is that I' m glad I made a promise to _ my golden years with this wonderful creature---- for Tom not only shares his life with me; he has made sure that I will be _ to share my life with him.
